definitions.text:
1. Smallness of quantity, or smallness in proportion to the wants or demands; deficiency defeat of plenty; penury; as scarcity of grain; great scarcity of beauties; scarcity of lovely women.Praise, like gold and diamonds, owes its value to its scarcity.A scarcity of snow would raise mutiny at Naples.
2. Rareness; infrequency.The value of an advantage is enhanced by its scarceness Root of scarcity, the mangold-wurzel, variety of the white beet.
